titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Steel Industries Engineering Corporation Records, 1931-1938 AIS.1964.36
titlestmt.author: ASC Staff. Revisions occurred to the finding aid as a part of the encoding process on November 5, 2001.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-07-08 17:13:11 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: The records of the Steel Industries Engineering Corporation include lists of officers and directors, memoranda on company dissolution, and correspondence of company heads.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This collection contains a list of officers and directors and memoranda on company dissolution. Included are the correspondence of chairman (Clifton Taylor), president (William Johnston, Jr.), vice-president (Jay W. Ferree), secretary (James G. Fulton), and treasurer (Ralph F. Leckey). The collection also contains company business correspondence with U.S. and foreign firms, financial records; business papers; legal papers; patents and patent information; specifications, photographs, information on products. The business papers and personal correspondence of William Johnston, Jr. are also included in the patent series.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of Charles E. Peterson, July 3, 1964.

odd.head: Previous Citation
odd.p: Steel Industries Engineering Corporation Records, 1931-1938, AIS.1964.36, Archives Service Center, University of Pittsburgh.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Steel Industries Engineering Corporation Records, 1931-1938, AIS.1964.36, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh Library System

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed by ASC Staff in 1964.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: Permission for publication is given on behalf of the University of Pittsburgh as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission of the copyright holder, which must also be obtained.
